text: the train is stationary at a place
called Bershka which is I woulda thought
40 minutes from Budapest what actually
happened the several hundred these
refugees had got on the train this
morning they waited in suffocating
conditions for three hours hoping that
this train would take them either to
Germany or close to the Austrian border
eventually it did leave there were some
police onboard but when he got to be
Shakur lining the platform were rows of
police and clearly the intention was to
take the refugees off the train and take
them to a centre where they would be
properly processed fingerprinted and
their details taken but the people on
board the train didn't want that there
was some jostling some struggling the
police put on their riot helmets and
then they tried to force the people who
had come off the first carriage down
some steps and then a really distressing
incident happened the woman who was
carrying a small baby began crying for
help one of her companions tried to help
her somehow that became a pushing shaft
with the police and she was ended up on
the railway lines with riot police
trying to pull her back and this of
course inflamed all the other people on
on the train and then they broke through
the lines and the people who had come
off the train got back on the train and
they would prefer just to stay on the
train rather than to go to this
processing centre and so Gavin these
people feel they've been misled they
thought they were heading to the
Austrian border and actually that's
right
and you can hear actually probably on my
phone it's people are shouting water
water from inside the carriages and some
are shouting Germany Germany I don't
think they were deliberately misled they
somehow believed that a train heading
west would take them close enough to the
Austrian border them to walk across but
that obviously wasn't the intention and
the intention here is to play by
existing EU rules and to process them
which is after what is supposed to
happen but of course that system is now
broken and in tatters and the truth is
that Europe's leaders do not have a
credible plan at the moment for dealing
this and and these distress
scenes which we're witnessing here on a
railway platform in the middle of
Hungary simply are a reflection of a
broken Asylum system in Europe there
doesn't seem to be any plan here
you know avec it some have been let
through to go through Austria some ours
have been sleeping rough for six days
they're told they can get on a train and
they can't get on a train these people
believed they were going to be able to
go down close to the Austrian border and
now they start here and I think all this
reflects I mean Viktor Orban the
Hungarian Prime Minister is in Brussels
today all of this reflects is that
Hungary like other countries doesn't
know how to deal with this crisis and of
course what is interesting on this train
it isn't just people who've come from
Syria very interesting to me there were
many many other nationalities all
looking to seize this opportunity to get
across the border into Austria and
Germany
